Location: Beraban, Kec. Kediri, Kabupaten Tabanan, Bali 82121
Description: Tanah Lot Temple is one of Bali's most important landmarks, famed for its unique offshore setting and sunset backdrops. An ancient Hindu shrine perched on top of an outcrop amidst constantly crashing waves.
Tourism/Visitor Fee (approx in USD): Yes, entrance tickets cost 30,000 Rupiah for Indonesian nationals (Rp 20,000 for children), but foreigners have to pay three times the price, or Rp 75.000 (Rp 40,000 for children).

Location: Batur Sel., Kec. Kintamani, Kabupaten Bangli, Bali
Description: This active volcano in Bali, Indonesia, is located at the center of two calderas. Mount Batur, which last erupted in 2000, is located one and a half hours from Ubud by car, and is a popular hiking spot. It’s recommended to make the hour-long climb in the early hours so you can reach the peak in time for sunrise. Just note that visibility may be limited during the rainy season between December and March. Don’t forget to explore Batur’s steaming crater rims and lava fields, or join a tour to enjoy a relaxing soak in a hot spring near Lake Batur.
Tourism/Visitor Fee (approx in USD): Yes, The Mount Batur trekking price is around IDR 100.000  - 400.000 per person. It may vary from one season to another. The Mount Batur trek cost will be around IDR 1.912.698 ($117 USD) for 3 people inclusive of registration, private transfer, and a guide till 1PM.

Location: Pecatu, Kec. Kuta Sel., Kabupaten Badung, Bali
Description: Uluwatu Temple (Pura Luhur Uluwatu) is one of six key temples believed to be Bali's spiritual pillars, is renowned for its magnificent location, perched on top of a steep cliff approximately 70 metres above sea level. This temple also shares the splendid sunset backdrops as that of Tanah Lot Temple, another important sea temple located in the island's western shores
Tourism/Visitor Fee (approx in USD): Yes, The Uluwatu Temple Bali entrance fee is IDR 50.000 ($3,07USD) per person for adults

Location: Jl. Monkey Forest, Ubud, Kecamatan Ubud, Kabupaten Gianyar, Bali 80571
Description: Explore the Sacred Monkey Forest in Ubud, a 12.5-hectare sanctuary home to over 1,200 long-tailed macaques. Our guide will offer tips for safe interaction and help you capture memorable photos.
Tourism/Visitor Fee (approx in USD): Yes, Visit to the Ubud Monkey Forest are subject to an entrance fee of 100,000 IDR ($6,13 USD) per person for adult, and 80,000 IDR ($4,91 USD) per person for kid. The ticket can be bought at the ticket counter which located just before the entrance gate of the forest.

Location: Bedulu, Kec. Blahbatuh, Kabupaten Gianyar, Bali
Description: Goa Gajah, or Elephant Cave, is located on the island of Bali near Ubud, in Indonesia. Built in the 9th century, it served as a sanctuary.
Tourism/Visitor Fee (approx in USD): Yes, Adult 50.000 IDR ($3,07 USD), Child 25.000 IDR($ 1,53 USD), Parking 2500 - 10000 IDR ($ 0.15 USD - 0,61 USD)

Location: Village, Jl. Jatiluwih Kawan No.Desa, Jatiluwih, Kec. Penebel, Kabupaten Tabanan, Bali 82152
Description: Nominated for designation as a UNESCO World Heritage site, Jatiluwih offers a beautiful view of contoured rice terraces irrigated using an impressive communal water system developed by Balinese farmers. The scenic drive through the quaint villages and verdant slopes of the central coastal regency of Tabanan adds to the experience.
Tourism/Visitor Fee (approx in USD): Yes, The entrance fee for Jatiluwih Rice Terrace is 75.000 IDR per person for adult (about $4,29 USD), 50.000 IDR for kids ($3,07 USD)and an extra 5,000 IDR (35c USD) for the car park.

Location: Jl. Raya Tegallalang, Tegallalang, Kec. Tegallalang, Kabupaten Gianyar, Bali 80561
Description: Tegalalang Rice Terrace comprises a series of cascading rice fields. A UNESCO World Heritage site, the area is especially popular during sunrise and sunset. Take your time to explore the terraces, visit the nearby Bali Pulina plantation, and have a go on the mountain-edge swings. To see the fields at their greenest, visit in March, August or September. They're also green in December and February but are slippery due to the rainy season. The rice terrace is commonly visited on a tour of Ubud which includes other places of interest like the Monkey Forest, Tegenugan Waterfall, and Tirta Empul Temple.
Tourism/Visitor Fee (approx in USD): Yes, 25,000 IDR ($1) per person, and 5000 ($ 0.33 USD) IDR for parking.

Location: Danau Beratan, Candikuning, Kec. Baturiti, Kabupaten Tabanan, Bali 82191
Description: Pura Ulun Danu Beratan, or Pura Bratan, is a major Hindu Shaivite temple in Bali, Indonesia.
Tourism/Visitor Fee (approx in USD): Yes, Adult 75.000 IDR ($4,60 USD)

Location: Kuta, Badung Regency, Bali
Description: Seminyak Beach is a beautiful white sandy beach situated in north of Legian Beach. The white sand stretching 3 km from Tuban area has made it a fascination for tourists to visit this place. Seminyak Beach is favored by the great wave that is ideally for surfing adventures hence many surfers visit this beach to conquer the waves and enjoy the surf adventures.
Tourism/Visitor Fee (approx in USD): Yes, depending on location and places visited.

Location: Benoa, Kec. Kuta Sel., Kabupaten Badung, Bali
Description: Nusa Dua is a resort area built in the 1970s in the southern part of Bali, Indonesia
Tourism/Visitor Fee (approx in USD): Yes, depending on location and places visited.

Location: Besakih countryside, Rendang sub district, Karangasem regency, Bali
Description: Over a thousand years old, Besakih Temple is known as the "Mother Temple of Bali". Perched on the slopes of Mount Agung, at a lofty 1000 metres (3000 feet)Pura Besakih is the paramount Hindu temple on Bali. Located high on the slopes of the volcano Mt. Agung, it has developed over more than a thousand years into a great complex of 22 separate temples, the largest and central being Pura Penataran Agung.
Tourism/Visitor Fee (approx in USD): Yes, visit to the Besakih Temple (Pura Besakih) are subject to an entrance fee of IDR 60,000 IDR ($ 4 USD) per person for adult, and IDR 30,000 ($ 2 USD) IDR per person for kid.

Location: Kuta District, Badung Regency, southern Bali
Description: Kuta is a tourist area, administratively an urban village (kelurahan), and the capital of Kuta District, Badung Regency, southern Bali, Indonesia. A former fishing village, it was one of the first towns on Bali to see substantial tourist development, and as a beach resort remains one of Indonesia's major tourist destinations.
Tourism/Visitor Fee (approx in USD): Kuta Beach is accessible 24 hours, 7 days a week. No entrance fee is required. Beach chairs with umbrellas cost 40,000 - 50,000 IDR ($2,44 - $3,05 USD)

Location: Jl. Pura Telaga Mas Lempuyang, Tri Buana, Kec. Abang, Kabupaten Karangasem, Bali 80852
Description: Pura Penataran Agung Lempuyang is a Balinese Hindu temple or pura located in the slope of Mount Lempuyang in Karangasem, Bali. Pura Penataran Agung Lempuyang is considered as part of a complex of pura surrounding Mount Lempuyang, one of the highly regarded temples of Bali.
Tourism/Visitor Fee (approx in USD): If previously visitors could explore the temple and give donations. Now for international visitors, the entrance fee is Rp50.000. The admission ticket doesn’t include a sarong, prepare Rp10.000 for the rent or bring one. Besides the entrance ticket, now to get to the temple visitors will have to park their private vehicles in the parking area. Then continue with the shuttle bus which cost another Rp50.000 for a return trip.

Location: Karangasem regency in East Bali
Description: Wapa di Ume Sidemen is an excellent choice for rest and rejuvenation. Well-known for its family-friendly environment and proximity to great restaurants, Wapa di Ume Sidemen makes it easy to enjoy the best of Sidemen.
Tourism/Visitor Fee (approx in USD): Yes, depending on location and places visited.

Location: Jl. Tirta, Manukaya, Kec. Tampaksiring, Kabupaten Gianyar, Bali 80552
Description: Built in the 10th-century, Tirta Empul temple is a Hindu Balinese water temple, and is considered sacred by the community. Worshippers take part in ancient cleansing rituals here and visitors are welcomed to join. Nestled in the lush Balinese countryside amid rice terraces and coffee plantations, the Vishnu-dedicated Hindu complex gets packed with devotees on full moon nights, when it takes on an even more special significance to them. You might get to watch a ceremonial dance performance too. For fewer crowds, visit early in the morning. After entering, you can rent a sarong for a small donation to wear during the ritual.
Tourism/Visitor Fee (approx in USD): Yes, visit to the Tirta Empul Temple are subject to an entrance fee of 50,000 IDR ($ 3.4 USD) per person for adult, and 25,000 IDR ($1.7 USD) per person for kid.

Location: Buleleng Regency, Bali, Indonesia
Description: West Bali National Park (Indonesian: Taman Nasional Bali Barat) is a national park located in Buleleng Regency, Bali, Indonesia.
Tourism/Visitor Fee (approx in USD): Yes, West Bali National Park Entrance Fee for foreigh: 200,000 IDR ($ 12,18 USD) and for domestic 200,000 IDR  ($ 12,18 USD)

Location: Uluwatu St, Ungasan, South Kuta, Badung Regency, Bali 80364
Description: Rising from the rugged hills of Bali’s Bukit Peninsula, the magnificent Garuda Wisnu Kencana statue stands watch over the island. The towering statue is Bali’s most iconic landmark and depicts the Hindu God Wisnu, atop his mount, the mythical eagle, Garuda. Soaring to a height of over 120 meters, this is one of the tallest monumental statues in the world, higher than both the Statue of Liberty and Christ the Redeemer. The statue makes a stunning central feature of GWK Cultural Park, a fascinating 60 hectare cultural park that draws visitors from around the globe and provides a tantalizing glimpse into Bali’s fascinating heritage through intriguing cultural performances, legendary folklore tales, immense sculptures and dramatic cinematic presentation.
Tourism/Visitor Fee (approx in USD): Yes, Garuda Wisnu Kencana Cultural Park Entrance Fee: Rp145.000 - Rp200.000 ($8,83  - 12,18 USD)

Location: Jl. Raya Singapadu, Singapadu, Kec. Sukawati, Kabupaten Gianyar, Bali 80582
Description: Bali's first and only zoological park is a wondrous place where you can learn the behavior of over 500 rare and exotic animals in a lush, tropical environment. A park where you can participate in fascinating animal adventure activities, some of which are unique experiences of their kind in Indonesia.
Tourism/Visitor Fee (approx in USD): Yes, Ticket Price 355,000 IDR ($ 21,62 USD) for adult and 252,000 IDR for children ($15,35 USD) , Openin Hours: 09:00 - 17:00.

Location: Jl. Serma Cok Ngurah Gambir Singapadu, Batubulan, Kec. Sukawati, Kabupaten Gianyar, Bali 80582
Description: Enjoy walking around and get along with a thousand birds and its habitat. The Park is divided into seven regions that recreate the natural habitats of our birds, complete with indigenous plant life. You can travel from the deep misty jungle of Sumatra to Far East Indonesia and Papua to discover the native birds from these remote regions. Venture to other tropical continents too. See the South American exotics such as the Golden Macaw and the Congo Grey Parrot from the African Savannah.
Tourism/Visitor Fee (approx in USD): Yes, The basic Bali Bird Park ticket foreigh costs IDR 385,000 ($ 24.54 USD) per person for adults and IDR 265,000 ($16,14 USD) for children between 2 to 12 years old.

Location: Jalan Raya Abang Desa Adat, Ababi, Kec. Abang, Kabupaten Karangasem, Bali 80852
Description: The former royal palace of Tirtagangga (which means water of the Ganges, Hinduism's holy river) features tiered fountains, gardens, and stone sculptures of mythical creatures spouting water into bathing pools. Just outside the palace grounds, the views of the lush rice paddies of northeastern Bali are stunning.
Tourism/Visitor Fee (approx in USD): Yes, Tirtagangga palace entrance fee is Rp90.000 ($ 5,48 USD)  for international tourists. The Tirtagangga Park swimming pool is included in the entrance ticket.

Location: Jl. Ir. Sutami, Kemenuh, Kec. Sukawati, Kabupaten Gianyar, Bali 80581
Description: Air Terjun Tegenungan is a beautiful natural waterfall located just a half-hour drive from Ubud. The lush greenery and picturesque falls are a great photo op to commemorate your trip to Bali. When the conditions are good, you can take a dip in the inviting pool at the base. For a bird's eye view of the falls, be sure to check out the viewpoint near the entrance. Also, note that there's a small fee to enter the waterfall. To make the most of your trip, take a guided tour to explore other waterfalls in Bali. And if you need a break, there are tourist shops and a day club nearby.
Tourism/Visitor Fee (approx in USD): Yes, visit to the Tegenungan Waterfall are subject to an entrance fee of 20,000 IDR ($ 1,22 USD) per person for adult and 10,000 IDR ($ 0,61 USD) per person for child. Tickets can be purchased at the ticket counter in the parking area in front of the waterfall entrance.

Location: Jl. Dewi Saraswati No.7, Bongkasa Pertiwi, Kec. Abiansemal, Kabupaten Badung, Bali 80352
Description: Adventure outfit offering a range of tours, rafting trips & rope swings with jungle views.
Tourism/Visitor Fee (approx in USD): Yes, 300,000 IDR ($ 22 USD) per person for adult (not including transport) and 370,000 IDR ($27 USD) per person for adult (including both sides transport from hotel/villa located in Ubud)

Location: Jl. Kartika Plaza, Tuban, Kec. Kuta, Kabupaten Badung, Bali 80361
Description: Exciting water slides slice through 3.8 hectares of landscaped tropical parks providing hours of fun and entertainment for the young and young at heart! World-class slides and rides are built and maintained to strict international safety standards. The advanced salt chlorination technique is soft on the environment and on your skin.
Tourism/Visitor Fee (approx in USD): Yes, However, single days pass costs around IDR 495,000 ($ 30,15 USD) for children who are 2 to 11 years old, IDR 595,000 ($ 36,24 USD) for adults, and IDR 2,010,000 ($ 122,42 USD) for family (2 adults, 2 children). There is a two-day pass also for those who want to visit again.

Location: Kelusa, Payangan, Jl. Raya Campuhan, Sayan, Kecamatan Ubud, Kabupaten Gianyar, Bali 80571
Description: Amid lush ravines and picturesque rice fields, the Campuhan Ridge Walk is one of the most popular treks in Ubud. You’ll start off the hike at the meeting point of the Wos Rivers by the historic core of this charming Bali town. Stop along the way to take in the views and recharge with some coffee overlooking the peaceful lily ponds. About three miles there and back, the trail is best enjoyed around sunrise and sunset, when temperatures are milder. After the hike, don’t miss Ubud’s vibrant city center, where you can shop for handicrafts and visit ancient landmarks
Tourism/Visitor Fee (approx in USD): Campuhan Ridge Walk is a free and easy nature trek, popular among regular visitors in the central highland town of Ubud. This trail presents a pristine outback to escape from the contemporary boutique, guesthouse and restaurant-lined Jalan Raya Ubud.

Location: Jl. Prof. Dr. Ida Bagus Mantra No.km 19, Serongga, Kec. Gianyar, Kabupaten Gianyar, Bali 80551
Description: Home to thousand amazing animals representing more than 100 species, including some of rare and endangered species. Combining Balinese cultural ambience with African Savannah, Bali Safari and Marine Park features the following exhibits featuring Sumatran elephant, Sumatran tiger, white tiger, leopard, komodo dragon are just some of the fascinating creatures that can be seen at the Bali Safari and Marine Park.
Tourism/Visitor Fee (approx in USD): Yes, the basic Bali Safari and Marine Park entry fee is IDR 650.000 (US $ 45.89) for adults (foreign) and IDR 576.000 (US $ 36.71) for children. For domestic visitors, the standard Safari Explorer ticket is IDR 175.000 for adults and IDR 135.000 for children.

Location: Jl. Raya Puputan No.142, Panjer, Denpasar Selatan, Kota Denpasar, Bali 80234
Description: Ornate, landmark monument to the Balinese people, with a grassy surrounding park.
Tourism/Visitor Fee (approx in USD): Yes, visit to the Bajra Sandhi Monument are subject to an entrance IDR 30,000 for adult and IDR 15,000 for child ($0.96 - 1.91 USD). parking fee 2,000 ($0,12 USD)

Location: Jalan Raya Sukawati, Sukawati, Kec. Sukawati, Kabupaten Gianyar, Bali 80582
Description: Sukawati art market, Gianyar, is a perfect place for those who just love to shop around or even for those who just want to see what typical Balinese souvenirs, gifts or crafts look like. If you can haggle and learn the average price, it will save you a lot of money compared to Legian, Kuta or Seminyak.You must dare to cut the offered price by 90 percent. They will probably pout or mumble in front of you but Sukawati art market is well known as a wholesale heaven so it should be that cheap; especially if you buy in bulk.
Tourism/Visitor Fee (approx in USD): Yes, depending on location and places visited.

Location: Ujung Water Palace, Tumbu, Kec. Karangasem, Kabupaten Karangasem, Bali 80811
Description: Taman Ujung ( Edge Sukasada Park ) was built in 1919. In the area , there are some buildings also large and spacious pool. There are three or entrance gate to the park area. The main gate is at a height on the west side as an entrance that is called "Bale Ship" because the build was once made to resemble a ship. Furthermore, this bale of our entrance into the park area with hundreds of fruits down the stairs. From this spot the entire area of the park can be enjoyed.
Tourism/Visitor Fee (approx in USD): Yes, Entry fee 100,000 IDR ($ 6,09 USD)

Location: Jl. Raya Denpasar Bedugul km. 36, Mekarsari, Baturiti, Mekarsari, Tabanan, Mekarsari, Kec. Baturiti, Kabupaten Tabanan, Bali 82191
Description: SECRET GARDEN VILLAGE is the enjoyment of EDUCATIONAL and FACTORY OUTLET holiday destination with indulgence of coffee and culinary experience. It's alluringly nestled at Jalan Raya Denpasar KM 36 Luwus, Tabanan. The venue is just 1 hour from Ngurah Rai International Airport. 30 minutes from Ubud and view a minutes away from other leisure options and facilities such as Bedugul Botanical Garden that has stunning green forest view, and Ulun Danu temple You will have a valuable experience to get to know in the making of our natural homemade body care products, learn the art of coffee processing for the coffee lover, and on top of that, be fascinated by the sight of the utmost beautiful garden and awesome landscape.
Tourism/Visitor Fee (approx in USD): Yes, starting from 50.000 ($ 3,05 USD).

Location: Jl. Penglipuran, Kubu, Kec. Bangli, Kabupaten Bangli, Bali 80611
Description: Traditional Balinese village selling handicrafts & local produce & offering homestay accommodation.
Tourism/Visitor Fee (approx in USD): Yes, starting from 25,000 - 50,000 IDR ($ 1,52 - 3,05 USD).

Location: Jalan Banjar, Banjar, Kec. Banjar, Kabupaten Buleleng, Bali 81152
Description: Hot springs complex surrounded by tropical gardens offering pools & showers, plus an eatery & a spa.
Tourism/Visitor Fee (approx in USD): Yes, Entry fee IDR 45,000 IDR ($ 2,74 USD) for International and 15,000 IDR for Domestic.

Location: Jl. Raya Pujung Kaja, Sebatu, Kec. Tegallalang, Kabupaten Gianyar, Bali 80561
Description: Bali Pulina is a coffee plantation, where we can learn how to make the most unique coffee of the world. we can also see other different types of plant and trees like cocoa , coffee, coconut, and also rice terrace paddy as the view that we enjoy during drinking the coffee. Rather that it, we could also play the game as Giant Swing tree, Zip line, and swimming pool right in the middle of jungle.
Tourism/Visitor Fee (approx in USD): Yes, starting from IDR 75,000 - 100,000 ($4,57  - 6,09  USD).

Location: CFX9+9GG, Jl. Raya Goa Lawah, Pesinggahan, Kec. Dawan, Kabupaten Klungkung, Bali 80761
Description: Goa Lawah, or "Bat Cave Temple," is one of Bali’s most sacred and unique temples, located in Pesinggahan Village, Klungkung. Built in the 11th century by Mpu Kuturan, this coastal temple is famed for the natural cave that serves as a home to thousands of bats, believed to hold spiritual significance. Goa Lawah is part of the Sad Kahyangan, the six holiest temples in Bali, and plays an important role in Balinese Hindu purification ceremonies. The temple complex blends natural and man-made elements, facing the sea with Mount Agung at its back, creating a powerful spiritual axis.
Tourism/Visitor Fee (approx in USD): Yes , Entrance fee is 25,000 IDR ($1,52 USD). if with sarong 30,000 IDR  ($1,83) per person

Location: Jl. Pantai Batu Bolong, Canggu, Kec. Kuta Utara, Kabupaten Badung, Bali
Description: This well-known sandy beach near shops & restaurants is popular with surfers & has board rentals
Tourism/Visitor Fee (approx in USD): Yes, parking fee is included ranging from 5000 IDR (car) and IDR 2000 (motorcycle), ($ 0.13 - 0.32 USD).

Location: Lemukih, Buleleng Regency
Description: Kumpulan tujuh air terjun tersembunyi di pegunungan Bali utara, ideal untuk trekking dan fotografi alam.
Tourism/Visitor Fee (approx in USD): Tiket Viewpoint: Rp 20.000 (~$1.28) Tiket Trek + Pemandu: Rp 250.000 (~$16) Parkir: Rp 2.000 (~$0.13)

Location: Wanagiri, Buleleng Regency
Description: Air terjun kembar yang dikelilingi hutan tropis, cocok untuk berenang dan menikmati ketenangan alam.
Tourism/Visitor Fee (approx in USD):
Tiket Masuk: Rp 10.000–20.000 (~$0.65–$1.30)

Parkir: Termasuk standar area wisata (~Rp 5.000–10.000) (estimasi)

Location: Tembuku, Bangli Regency
Description: Air terjun unik di dalam tebing batu yang menciptakan efek cahaya dramatis saat matahari masuk.
Tourism/Visitor Fee (approx in USD): Tiket Masuk: Rp 10.000–15.000 (~$0.65–$1.00) (estimasi dari lokasi serupa)

Location: Munduk, Banjar, Buleleng Regency, Bali
Description: Danau alami di pegunungan utara Bali yang tenang dan asri, populer untuk trekking dan canoeing tradisional.
Tourism/Visitor Fee (approx in USD):
Tiket Masuk: Rp 10.000 (~$0.65)

Parkir Motor: Rp 3.000 (~$0.20)

Parkir Mobil: Rp 5.000 (~$0.33)

Location: Sumber Klampok, Gerokgak, Buleleng Regency, Bali
Description: Pulau kecil di barat laut Bali, populer untuk snorkeling dan diving dengan terumbu karang indah.
Tourism/Visitor Fee (approx in USD):
Tiket Taman Nasional (Snorkeling Diver Mudah): Rp 200.000–300.000 (~$13.00–$20.00)

Charter Boat & Snorkeling Package: Mulai Rp 425.000 (~$27.50) per orang (termasuk perahu, alat, dan makan)

Location: Desa Adat Bugbug, Sengkidu, Manggis, Karangasem Regency, Bali
Description: Bukit menampilkan panorama Samudra Hindia dari tebing tinggi, ideal untuk sunrise/sunset dan aktivasi adrenalin seperti water swinging di atas Danau Buyan
Tourism/Visitor Fee (approx in USD): Tiket Masuk: Rp 25.000 (~$1.64)

Location: Beji Guwang, Sukawati, Gianyar Regency
Description: Canyoning alami dengan air biru jernih, trekking ringan di antara tebing dan sungai sempit penuh vegetasi .
Tourism/Visitor Fee (approx in USD):
Tiket Masuk: Rp 15.000 (~$1.00)

Dengan Pemandu (opsional): Rp 100.000–125.000 (~$6.50–$8.00)

Location: Manggissari, Pekutatan, Jembrana Regency, West Bali
Description: Pohon beringin raksasa dengan akar membentuk terowongan yang bisa dilewati kendaraan, dianggap sakral dan penuh legenda — spot unik dan mistis
Tourism/Visitor Fee (approx in USD):
Tiket Masuk: Gratis

Parkir: Rp 2.000 (motor), Rp 5.000 (mobil)

Location: Jl. Pantai Batu Mejan No.9, Canggu, Kec. Kuta Utara, Kabupaten Badung, Bali 80361
Description: G Swing Bali is a spine tingling extreme swing ride in Canggu! You and up to 4 friends are slowly lifted up to 40 meters. As you're being lifted, the orientation of your chairs is also shifting. By the time you reach the peak, swingers will be facing downward. Then, 1 person is responsible to hitting the release lever. You'll instantly drop, creating a freefall effect, before the cable alters your direction forward, until you reach peak height on the other side of the towers.
Tourism/Visitor Fee (approx in USD): Tiket masuk untuk 1 orang (+Rp 350.000) dan 2 orang (+Rp 650.000)

Place: ATV Quad Bike Bali with Waterfall Gorilla Cave
Location: Jl. Raya Payangan No.199, Puhu, Kec. Payangan, Kabupaten Gianyar, Bali 80572
Description: Get off the beaten path on this private all-terrain vehicle (ATV) tour of the countryside near Ubud. After a full safety briefing, hop on your ATV and follow your guide through the unseen side of Bali past rice paddies, plantations, jungles, and picturesque villages. This tour includes lunch and pickup and drop-off from many areas in Bali.
Tourism/Visitor Fee (approx in USD): Tiket 445.000 IDR per orang ($27,20 USD)

Location: Jl. Padma No.1, Legian, Kec. Kuta, Kabupaten Badung, Bali 80361
Description: Padma Resort Legian is previously known as Padma Resort Bali at Legian. Acclaimed as a five-star art sanctuary, Padma Resort Legian is a serene paradise under the dancing shadows of the renowned Legian sunset. Just steps away from the traditional art and fashion market of Legian street, the resort is a sanctuary at one with nature. Spaciously set within a romantic 6.8-hectare garden landscape, the resort provides comfortable accommodation, world-class facilities and the celebrated Balinese hospitality that promise wonderful stays for discerning travelers.
Tourism/Visitor Fee (approx in USD): Harga permalam 4,000,000 IDR - 5,000,000 IDR per orang

Location: Jl. Goa Lempeh, Uluwatu, Kec. Kuta Sel., Kabupaten Badung, Bali 80361
Description: Six Senses Uluwatu, Bali is located at Pecatu in the southernmost tip of Bali which is the home of "Pura Uluwatu", the sacred Uluwatu temple, considered one of the core spiritual pillars of the island. Uluwatu is where centuries-old tradition and reverence mixes with beautiful beaches, inviting surfing spots and an eclectic wellness and dining scene. The setting of this beautiful Balinese inspired resort is breathtaking, with dramatic views of the Indian Ocean from atop the limestone cliffs and uninterrupted ocean views from all facets of the resort.
Tourism/Visitor Fee (approx in USD): Harga permalam 11,000,000 IDR - 11,700,000 IDR untuk 2 orang

Location: Complex Bali Tourism Development Corporation / ITDC Area Block P, Benoa, South Kuta, Badung Regency, Bali 80361
Description: ​Visiting the Pasifika art collection is one of a time opportunity to relax in an oasis of tranquillity and to view an extraordinary collection of paintings and other artworks. It is housed in an exquisite modern Balinese building designed by Popo Danes, one of the most celebrated Balinese architect. There will be Indonesian and Balinese artworks but also numerous paintings by those bohemian artists who came from Europe and other parts of the world starting from the 1930s, succumbing to the spells of the enchanting tropical Island.
Tourism/Visitor Fee (approx in USD): Tiket masuk untuk per orang 65,000 IDR (include Drinks (Tea, Coffee, or Infuse Water) + Free Shuttle ITDC Area)

Location: Jl. Kajeng, Ubud, Kecamatan Ubud, Kabupaten Gianyar, Bali 80571
Description: Saraswati temple Kingdom of Ubud is dedicated to honor the Hindu Goddess Saraswati, the goddess of learning, literature and art. This temple is very beautiful and artistic, so many tourists who come to see its charm, but for purposes of worship. Pura Taman Saraswati has a water garden and lotus pond at the center of its attraction as a tourist attraction.This temple is decorated with so many fine carvings and inside there Padmasana shrine located in the northeast, but it also contained bale barong, giant masks, statues of Goddess Saraswati and the statue of the devil Jero Gede Mecaling as high as 3 meters in front of the temple.
Tourism/Visitor Fee (approx in USD): Entrance fee 60,000 IDR ($3,67 USD) per person

Location: Jl. Ayodya No.10, Mengwi, Kec. Mengwi, Kabupaten Badung, Bali 80351
Description: Taman Ayun Temple is a Royal Temple of Mengwi Empire and it is located in Mengwi Village, Mengwi sub district, Badung regency and about 18 Km north side of Denpasar town. It is strategically located beside of major roadway between Denpasar to Singaraja. It is set on the land which is surrounded by the big fish pond and look like a drift on the water
Tourism/Visitor Fee (approx in USD): Entrance fee for foreigners 30,000 IDR ($1,83 USD) per person (includes photo exhibition + short video)
